oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Y. M. C. A. Building, Nashville, Tenn., circa 1912
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Nashville Young Men's Christian Association, an eight-story, fire proof building, located at the corner of Seventh Avenue and Union Street and Capitol boulevard in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. Completed in 1912, the Y. M. C. A. trained men and boys for physical, mental and spiritual efficiency. The facility included approximately 181 apartment rooms for residents. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Young Men's Christian Association of Nashville
